description.narrative: GGF funds will support the FishBase Information and Research Group's efforts to develop online information system, SeaLifeBase, on the more than 200,000 marine species in the world's oceans. This information system is designed to provide basic summaries of biological data as well as respond to ecological modeling queries for large marine ecosystems or as required by the Sea Around Us and similar projects performing global analyses of the world's ocean resources. In 2014 SeaLifeBase will work with the Sea Around Us to cover the marine biodiversity of ecosystems included in the Western Indian Ocean (including the Red Sea and the Persian Gulf). This is area that is exposed to heavy tourism and military activities, creating disruptions to the ecosystems in the area. The SeaLifeBase system will provide detailed information on the area's levels of biodiversity.
